page.title: 01CANDYMILL
page.content: This block is divided by the A702 from Edinburgh to Biggar - Dumfries and the south, a road not built for the heavy traffic it has to carry. The Candy Burn flowing on the eastern side of the road is the boundary between Tweedale district of Borders region and Clydesdale district in Strathclyde. The larger centre of population is Skirling (Skravelyn) in the south east Tweedale with the small hamlet of Candymill in the north in Clydesdale. The name derives from the former Edmonster meal mill now made into a fine residence. The nearby Edmonster House is still also a family home. Shirling House, a fairly recent half-timbered country mansion where the Laird (squire) has died, is being sold with the remains of the once large Skirling Estate. It stands beside the lovely village green.
